items.title: Black Friday Mac deals – if you’re buying one this year, do it now
items.summary:
Amazon’s official main event sale is now live, and the Black Friday Mac deals are not playing around this year. Not only are we seeing some of the best prices ever on Apple’s most affordable current-gen machine – you can literally bring a brand new Mac home right now at under $480 (that’s wild), but its most sought-after and accessible MacBook Air is now at the best prices ever with as much as $300 in savings. On top of that, the M5 MacBook Pro, with not much more than a month under the sun now, is already $250 off. Black Friday is Black Fridaying folks, if you have a Mac in your near future, now’s the time to grab one. Scope out the best Black Friday Mac deals below.

items.summary:
It’s the greatest shopping time of the year folks, with Black Friday sales well into full gear, and once again we’re seeing some of the best prices on Green Deals of all sorts – EVs, power stations, tools, and eco-friendly appliances. We’ve got an amazing lineup this year, with tons of new releases from over 2025 joining legacy favorites so you can get everything you need in one place to cover all your holiday shopping. items.title: EcoFlow launches next Black Friday Sale phase with up to 80% off expanded lineup – starts from $149
items.summary:
EcoFlow has officially switched to its next Black Friday Sale phase of deals with up to 80% discounts, plenty of FREE gifts, bonus savings, and more. Among the new lineup, we spotted EcoFlow’s DELTA Pro Portable Power Station bundled with 2x 220W solar panels and a FREE protective bag at $1,699 shipped, which is not only being exclusively offered direct from the brand, but is also dropping things lower than ever. One thing to note here is that, sadly, the extra savings code isn’t valid on this bundle. It would normally run you $5,199 for everything (including the $99 bag), with the bagless bundle at Amazon keeping lower at a starting rate of $3,999 and only dropping to $1,999 right now. This deal comes in $100 under its previous offer during the brand’s Halloween Sale, giving you a total $2,300 off the going rate ($3,500 off the MSRP) for the best new price that we have tracked anywhere. Be sure to head below to check out the newest phase of full Black Friday deals.

more…

items.title: Lectric’s Black Friday Sale offers up to $893 bundles with e-bikes starting from $999
items.summary:
The month is kicking off big for folks looking to score a commuting solution from one of America’s favorite e-bike brands. Lectric eBikes has launched its early Black Friday Sale that is seeing up to $893 in savings across the e-bike lineup, including another $500 price cut on the premium ONE commuter and up to 25% discounts on accessories. Leading the group with some of the biggest bundles are Lectric’s XPedition Cargo e-bikes, which can be broken down into three configurations: the starting 13Ah single-battery e-bike with $346 in gear at $1,399 shipped, the 26Ah dual-battery e-bike with $744 in gear at $1,799 shipped, or the 35Ah dual-battery long-range e-bike with $893 in gear at $1,999 shipped. These bundles would normally run you $1,745, $2,543, and $2,892, respectively, but now, you’re getting the largest packages we’ve tracked since this second-generation hauler hit the market one year ago.

more…

items.title: Anker’s extended SOLIX Black Friday Sale increases power station savings up to 70% with new lows starting from $150
items.summary:
Update 11/28: As expected, Anker SOLIX has extended its Black Friday Sale through Cyber Monday, with some increased pricing on select models, which has been updated below.

Anker SOLIX has launched the next phase of its ongoing Black Friday Sale with increased savings up to 70% across its power stations, bundles, and accessories, giving us the best prices we have seen all year – complete with free gifts with select purchases and at certain price thresholds. Among the expanded lineup, you can score the latest F3000 Portable Power Station starting solo at $1,199 shipped and coming with a FREE protective cover ($99 value), matching in price over at Amazon, though you won’t get the cover there. This new model has been on the market since June carrying a $2,599 full price tag, which we’ve seen go as low as $1,399 up until today. Now, with its Black Friday event in full gear, you’re getting an additional $200 discount to a new all-time low price, giving you a total $1,499 in savings this holiday season. Head below for the full rundown of deals while they’re around.

You’d normally have to pay $440, $600, and $760 for these lights at full price, which have previously fallen as low as $280, $380, and $460 in their time on the market. While the 150-foot model is sitting $10 above its lowest rate, the 100-foot and 200-foot models are going lower than ever before, complete with $180 and $300 markdowns to land at new all-time low prices.

items.title: Bring home KitchenAid’s tilt-head stand mixers + attachments with up to 33% Black Friday savings from $50
items.summary:
As part of its Black Friday Week Sale, Amazon is offering up to 33% discounts on KitchenAid stand mixers and attachments, like the tried-and-true Artisan Series 5-Quart Tilt-Head Stand Mixer that is down at $349.95 shipped. It’s coming down from its $500 price tag during this seasonal event, returning to the lowest price that we have tracked over 2025. While it has gone a little further in past years, you’re still looking at a $150 markdown that lands it at the best price of the year. Of course, you could save a bit more by choosing the brand’s smaller Classic Series 4.5-Quart Tilt-Head Mixer at $279 shipped, or the Artisan Mini 3.5-Quart Tilt-Head Mixer at $299.95 shipped. I’ve also collected many of my favorite attachments for these mixers below, as well, which only expand their versatility and prove even more why these are the last mixers you’ll ever need to buy for at-home baking, cooking, and much more.

Believe it or not, Thanksgiving is already behind us and soon Black Friday will be too. One think you may have forgotten however is that Cyber Monday is still around the corner. If history can tell us anything, some deals will stay on sale over the weekend, some will pop back up and drop back down come Monday, and others will jump up and stay up until who knows when. Yes, there are bound to be some situations where an item drops even further in price for Cyber Monday, but that is probably the least common outcome we tend to see. Bearing that in mind, if anything in our collection Black Friday deals under $50 catches your eye, you may want to grab it while you can. Head down below to see them all.

Amazon is serving up some serious deals on a range of Timex and Citizen watches, many of which deliver that classic, high-end look reminiscent of luxury timepieces, without the luxury price tag. You can score up to 52% off select styles, making it the perfect time to start building your watch collection or pick up a thoughtful gift for someone special.

This heated jacket is ready to help keep you warm for up to 11 hours per charge. There are three settings in tow that reach 100, 113, and 131 degrees Fahrenheit.

Delamu 48- by 36-inch Office Desk Chair Mat

Buy for $20 (Reg. $33)

What we love

A lot of desk chair mats are clear and look about the same, but this offering takes a bit of a different approace with a woven design that’s made from PVC. The color is a mix between black and brown, giving it a bit of contrast when compared with more traditional options.

items.title: Black Friday Android game and app deals: Giant collection of top-tier titles now on sale
items.summary:
While much of the attention is landing on Amazon’s official Black Friday sale today, the Google Play Store has been bursting at the seams for over a week with top-notch price drops on Android games. Alongside all of the apps, you’ll want to make sure you scope out the Google Pixel 10 and 10 Pro deals at up to $300 off as well as the Pixel Watch 4 at up to $100 off and the Pixel Buds Pro 2 while they are still well below the official Black Friday price too. As for the apps, everything awaits below.
